epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Email of LSHTM Faculty/Dept contact responsible for the data collection
The person to contact for further information on this project.
A brief description of the project.
Items where faculty/department is "" and Year is
Browse by year where faculty/department is ""
Browse by Year where Subject is ""
Items where research centre is "" and year is
Browse by year where research centre is ""
The Research Centre with which this Data Collection should be associated. Multiple centres may be selected by holding the CTRL key.
The name of the person who will be using the data or leading the analysis process

epp:phrase.a: Licence document attached to this item

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: I agree to the terms and conditions for this dataset, as set out in the associated licence

Enter a brief description of this file.
Example: Example: Perceptions of smoking among teenagers in Wales survey results; SPSS format

The content of the data file
Data: research outputs in a re-usable form, e.g. CSV, SPSS, etc.
Data visualization: graphical representation of the data, e.g. a bar chart held in a PDF document
Documentation: supporting information that aids in understanding the data
Licence form: documentation that specify conditions of access and use for the data

The security level will specify who is allowed to download the file:
Anyone – all users
Registered users – LSHTM staff and other registered users
Repository staff – Repository staff only. Request access for others
You may set an embargo period for this file, indicating the date that it will be made public. Leave this field blank if it can be made available immediately

epp:phrase.p: Specify a licence that outlines how the file may be used by a user. This does not affect the access rights you grant to the repository at the end of this deposit process.
You are encouraged to upload any Material Transfer Agreement, Data Sharing Agreement, or other licence form as an associated file
If you require an explanation of Creative Commons and Open Data Commons, please contact the RDM Support Service

epp:phrases.epp:phrase:
The title of the data collection/project. The title should not end with a full stop, but may end with a question mark. If there is a subtitle, it should be preceded with a colon [:]. Use capitals only for the first word and for proper nouns.
Example: Perceptions of smoking among teenagers in Wales survey

An alternative title used to refer to the item. Leave blank if unnecessary.
Example: A non-english title
The title should not end with a full stop, but may end with a question mark. If there is a subtitle, it should be preceded with a colon [:]. Use capitals only for the first word and for proper nouns.
A written description of the item. If a formal abstract has been produced, it should be entered here. No complicated text formatting is possible.

State the name and details of the creators/authors in the format indicated below. A look-up of LSHTM staff members will be performed when the surname is provided. An optional ORCID researcher ID may also be provided, if known. If there are more than two creators, click the [More input rows] button.
Example: [Smith] [Richard.] [richard.smith@lshtm.ac.uk]
Example: [Archer] [Jonathan] [jonathan.archer@udsm.ac.tz]
Institutions that were involved in the creation of this dataset, e.g. a collaborating university, an external laboratory.

epp:phrase.p: Indicate any other individuals who had a part in the data’s creation and their role. Names will be displayed on the public data collection page, but will not be used for browsing purposes.
To suggest other contribution types, email researchdatamanagement@lshtm.ac.uk

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: If there are access restrictions on any of the files in this dataset, requests to view and access these items will be sent to this email address. The email address will not be made public.
The faculty and department with which this Data Collection should be associated. Multiple departments may be selected by holding the CTRL key.
State the institutions or individuals that are involved in the work. E.g. LSHTM, a funding body, etc.
The date this dataset was completed, submitted for publication, or published. If you do not know the day or month, these can be left blank.
State the name of the project in which the data was created or captured. Otherwise, leave blank.

If the data collection has been published prior to deposit here, please state by whom. Do not use abbreviations, enter in full.
Example: Oxford University Press
If the dataset has been published prior to deposit here (e.g. in a journal’s data repository), provide a URL indicating its location.
Enter any additional external resources related to the data. If the data has been published elsewhere the URL should be provided and classified as an 'Online Data Resource'.
This will add a coin-DOI event to the event queue (i.e. Will not happen immediately)
This item will have a DOI coined when the indexer gets around to it.
Research groups with which the data collection is associated.
Dataset not available from this repository.
The time period during which data was created, captured, or generated
Indicate the method (or methods) that were used to capture data. E.g. interview, questionnaire.
The start and end date of the project
Content Coding: Qualitative data converted into quantitative

epp:phrase.p: This item has been requested from by . Please can you respond.
Please consider removing restrictions or uploading the data to the archive so that it will be available immediately to future searchers.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine
London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine
London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine
An institution with which you are associated
Terms and conditions for access and use of data set are set out in the accompanying licence document.

epp:phrase.h3: Search for data collections to associate with this the project

epp:phrase.p: Data collections currently associated with this project:

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: LSHTM staff & other registered users (request access for others)
Repository administrators only (request access for others)

td.p: If this is your first time depositing, or if you require more information on any aspect of the deposit process, you may wish to view our Help page.

epp:phrase.p: Click the Browse button below to select a file and the Upload button to upload it to the repository. If you are uploading a large number of files, you may find uploading and describing each file separately cumbersome. In these situations we suggest you upload the files in logically grouped zip archives instead.
Please note that your progress will automatically be saved when you click 'Next' or 'Save and Return' above. Clicking 'Cancel' will result in the loss of any changes since last save.
The orange star symbol indicates a mandatory field.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Please indicate the type of file that has been provided
Enter keywords or phrases that best describe this data collection.

An important date in the dataset lifecycle
Completion: Date the dataset was completed
Submission: Date the dataset was submitted for publication elsewhere
Publication: Date the dataset was published elsewhere
You should specify the completion date in most cases.
Submitted for publication (e.g. in a journal)
Use this field for any useful information about your project/data that can't be entered anywhere else. This information will appear on the public summary page for this deposit.
State the name of the project in which the data was created or captured. Otherwise, leave blank.

epp:phrase.p: For work being deposited by its own author: By depositing this collection of files and associated metadata, I grant the right to store and to make them available for online access. I declare that this material is my own intellectual property and I understand that does not assume any responsibility if there is any breach of copyright, data protection or other legal requirement in distributing these files or metadata.

For work being deposited by someone other than its author: I hereby declare that the collection of files and associated metadata that I am archiving at is being deposited with the permission of the data creator and/or rights holder. If this is not the case, I accept full responsibility for any breach of copyright or other legal requirement that distributing these files or metadata may entail.
Clicking on the deposit button indicates your agreement to these terms.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: This search/browse menu allows you to associate your Data Collection with a Project record in this repository (if one exists for your project). If a Project record doesn't exist, you can ignore this field.
Describe the purpose of the analysis that you wish to perform and methods that will be applied.
Minimum period for which LSHTM should retain data files
A file embargo date cannot be more than in the future.

If the data creator has stated they will make available only a limited number of data values in a tabular dataset, you should use this field to specify the values that you are requesting. Otherwise leave this field blank.
Provide any additional information that may support your access request, e.g. academic profile
Look-up associated publication in LSHTM ResearchOnline

epp:phrase.p: If your data collection is analysed in a publication held in LSHTM ResearchOnline, you can link the two resources. This data collection's record will contain a web link to the publication and the publication will be updated to link to this data collection.
Type the first 5 letters of the title and select the correct publication from the search list.

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Select a reason from the drop down list. If you wish you may enter you own reason in the box below and leave this field "unspecified".
State any embargo period required before this metadata can be published.

Draw a rectangle that shows a geographical location relevant to the data. E.g. a broad area where the data was captured. Note that the hand icon allows navigation and clicking on the map, while the square icon allows a new bounding box to be drawn. You may also stretch any rectangle to change its size.
Provide the funder grant number of your project, if applicable
The full name of the funder or sponsor that supported the research. Do not enter the funder acronym.

Use this to submit a new version of this item. It will create an exact copy which you can then make changes to. This item and the new version will be linked. If you are unsure whether a new version is required please contact the Research Data Managment Support Service.
Select one or more values from the list (hold Ctrl to select more than one option), and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Select one or more values from the list (hold Ctrl to select more than one option), and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Please note that the pins shown are centred in a geographical bounding box and therefore represent an approximation of the location of the study.
